discourse_list.title: MKR locked into AAVE \xe2\x80\x94 Can I still vote?

content.content: Sorry for the beginner question — but just looking for clarity as a long-time holder of MKR but have never been able to figure out how to vote with my MKR. If I have my MKR tokens locked into AAVE (I’ve borrowed against my MKR tokens to purchase more MKR) — am I able to still vote with my MKR? Or, because it’s locked into AAVE, am I unable to vote with those tokens?
As they are not in your wallet, but in the AAVE contract, the tokens you initially deposited as collateral are not, but the tokens you borrowed are.
You cannot vote with tokens locked in Aave. It would be possible to build an integration that allowed it, but today it’s not possible.
But then couldn’t I vote lots of times on the same token? If I deposit to get aMKR and then borrow back my own MKR and vote with both?

My idea would be to somehow construct a lending market against the IOU token you get when you deposit MKR. There is no way to double spend it, so you would not be able to vote twice with it. It would make most sense if you can only supply it as collateral, and not be borrowed. However in case you can borrow it, you would just be shuffling votes around, the total amount would still be the same. I think you would need some kind of intermediary contract to handle the deposit balances in the DS-Chief.
